skill.name: plan
skill.description: Plan lifecycle management for Codex plans stored in $CODEX_HOME/plans (default ~/.codex/plans). Use when a user asks to create, find, read, update, delete, or manage plan documents for implementation work or overview/reference documentation.
skill.summary: Plan lifecycle management for Codex plans stored in $CODEX_HOME/plans (default ~/.codex/plans). Use ...
skill.author: BenderFendor

security_audit.summary: Python-based plan management skill with filesystem access limited to ~/.codex/plans directory. Legitimate use of CODEX_HOME environment variable for configuration. No network calls or external command execution. Input validation and path sanitization present.

low_findings.title: Environment variable for plans directory
low_findings.description: The skill reads the CODEX_HOME environment variable to determine the plans directory location. An attacker with control over the environment could redirect writes to arbitrary locations. However, the scope is limited to the user's home directory context. Code: `Path(os.environ.get("CODEX_HOME", "~/.codex")).expanduser()` at scripts/plan_utils.py:15.

content.value_statement: Manage implementation and overview plans as markdown documents with structured YAML frontmatter. Store, retrieve, and organize plans in a consistent format for development work and reference documentation.
actual_capabilities: Create markdown plans with YAML frontmatter in ~/.codex/plans
List and filter existing plans by name or description
Read and validate plan frontmatter metadata
Update and overwrite existing plan documents
Enforce naming conventions for plan files
Support implementation and overview plan templates
limitations: Only reads and writes to the plans directory under CODEX_HOME
Cannot modify source code or repository files
Requires manual user confirmation for delete operations
Frontmatter is limited to name and description fields

use_cases.title: Track implementation steps
use_cases.description: Create step-by-step implementation plans with requirements, scope, action items, and testing guidance.

use_cases.title: Document system architecture
use_cases.description: Create overview plans documenting flows, architecture, routing, and key file references.

use_cases.title: Manage project context
use_cases.description: Store and retrieve plans to maintain context across multiple development sessions.

prompt_templates.title: List all plans
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all my plans in the plans directory. Use list_plans.py to display them.

prompt_templates.title: Read a plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Read the frontmatter and contents of the codex-rate-limit-overview plan. Validate that the name matches the filename.

prompt_templates.title: Create implementation plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an implementation plan for adding user authentication. First read the relevant documentation, then draft a plan with requirements, scope, files, action items, and risks.

prompt_templates.title: Create overview plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an overview plan documenting the authentication flow, routing behavior, and key file references of the current system. First read the relevant documentation and key files, then draft an overview plan with flow, architecture, routing, and file references sections.
prompt_templates.description: Document the authentication flow, routing behavior, and key file references for the current system.

anti_patterns: Modifying the plan name without renaming the file

faq.question: Where are my plans stored?
faq.answer: Plans are stored in ~/.codex/plans by default. Set CODEX_HOME environment variable to use a different directory.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill is compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code tools for plan management tasks.

faq.question: What formats are supported?
faq.answer: Plans use markdown with YAML frontmatter containing name and description fields. Two templates are provided.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Plans are only written to the designated plans directory. The skill never modifies repository source code.

faq.question: How do I update an existing plan?
faq.answer: Load the plan first, then revise content while preserving frontmatter. Use --overwrite flag when creating.

faq.question: How is this different from regular notes?
faq.answer: Plans enforce a structured format with frontmatter metadata, action items, and cross-references to code files.
